revised_title: Generalizing Size and Abundance Patterns in Marine, Freshwater, and Terrestrial Animal Assemblages
tldr: This study examines the relationship between body size and population abundance in animal assemblages from marine, freshwater, and terrestrial environments. The research finds that the scaling of abundance on body size differs significantly within individual assemblages and challenges the energetic equivalence rule, which suggests that all species in assemblages use equal amounts of energy. The findings highlight the complexity of understanding size-abundance patterns across different ecosystems.
